description.narrative: 1. Decrease operating cost of telecoms to facilitate mobile network coverage expansion in remote areas; 2. Contribute to climate change mitigation by reduced diesel consumption and carbon emissions; 3. Generate local jobs at the hubs and satellites established by Fluidic as well as jobs created during installation in remote areas; 4. Promote investment in IDA countries; and 5. Demonstration effect: an investment in Fluidic further enables the Green Power for Mobile initiative, a joint initiative between IFC and GSMA, which aims to replace diesel consumption in the mobile telecom sector in developing countries and especially in Sub Saharan Africa.

Headquartered in Scottsdale, Arizona, Fluidic Energy (Fluidic or the Company) is an early stage provider of energy storage systems with significant operations in Indonesia. Founded in 2007, the Company supplies zinc-air batteries to support critical loads and backup power applications worldwide. The Companys products are capable of covering ultra-long outages at the lowest cost, and include remote site management, multi-year performance warranties and innovative financing terms. Additionally, Fluidics solutions offer customers significant operating and capital savings making it a viable alternative to the backup incumbent: diesel generators and lead-acid batteries. The Companys proposed investment plan is focused on the scale up of production in Indonesia, the acceleration of its commercial rollout in the emerging markets and continued research and development.
